title: Apricot Jam

ingredients.content: 1000 g apricots, fresh, stoned and quartered

preparations.content: Place apricots, jam sugar and lemon juice in mixing bowl then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>25 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, sterilise jam jars (see tip).
Test setting point of jam (see tip). Transfer to the warm sterilised jars and seal immediately. Label before storing in a cool, dry place. Once opened, store in fridge.

hintsAndTricks: To sterilise jam jars, preheat oven to 120°C then wash jars well. Place clean jars on a baking tray then heat for approx. 20 minutes (120°C). Always pour hot jam into still warm jars.

Setting point test: place a saucer in the freezer for 5-10 minutes. Place 1 tsp jam onto cold saucer. When cool, push jam with your finger. If it wrinkles, it is ready. If not, boil jam for a further <b>2 min/110°C/speed 1<b>, then test again.
To make a smaller amount of jam, halve the recipe to 500 g fruit, 300 g sugar and 25 g lemon juice then cook for the same time, <b>25 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
